settings.markdownTextPattern:
US AQI
info_outline
0-50
Air is clean
It's worth taking a walk or airing out the room.
51-100
Air is moderately clean
Unusually sensitive individuals should consider limiting prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
101-150
Air is unhealthy for sensitive groups
People with asthma, children and older adults should limit prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
151-200
Air is unhealthy
People with asthma, children and older adults should avoid prolonged exertion near roadways; everyone else should reduce outdoor exertion.
201-300
Air is very unhealthy
People with asthma, children and older adults should avoid all outdoor exertion; everyone else should avoid prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
>301
Air is hazardous
Everyone should avoid all outdoor exertion.

What is US AQI?
The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has developed theAir Quality Index. It is based on the measurement of five major pollutants:
  • ground-level ozone (O₃)
  • particle pollution (PM 2.5, PM 10)
  • carbon monoxide (CO)
  • sulfur dioxide (SO₂)
  • nitrogen dioxide (NO₂)
Each pollutant has its own AQI. The highest value is indicated as the overall AQI for the area. The higher the AQI value, the higher the level of air pollution and impact on health.
AQI quality levels
